texts.name: Will
texts.text: Mm...

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Why so pensive? Writing a new piece?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Yeah, it's a new piece all right, but...

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: You're stuck? I'll read it for you. What kind of story is it?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Actually...
I place the object of my dismay on the counter.
Olivia immediately regards it with suspicion.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Huh? What's this? It stinks.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: It's supposed to be pottage stew.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Pottage? Ah, I see. I thought you drank too much and barfed into the bowl or something of the like.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Did you just call my food vomit?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I think you underestimate the way it stinks... *Sniff* What in name of the Lord did you put in this... this thing...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Potatoes.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Okay... Well, that sounds very standard. Why does it smell so bloody sour, though?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Try it out and you'll see.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: You want me to put that sour, stinking regurgitation in my mouth? Am I hearing this right?
I nod, trying to block out the way she keeps likening my food to vomit.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Believe in me, my love.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: ...You didn't put anything weird in this, did you?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: It's an experiment for a new menu item. I wouldn't put anything strange in it.
With obvious trepidation, Olivia picks up a spoon as she looks down at the bowl the same way one would look at a heap of trash.
She takes a spoonful and raises it to her mouth.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: How is it?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: As sour as I imagined.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Doesn't it have a refreshing aftertaste?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Not at all.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Hmm...

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I wasn't even aware that pottage soup was, well, a thing in the first place. What did you put in this?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: The main ingredients are potatoes and milk, right? Then I added salt and pepper.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Uh, did you make sure the milk wasn't bad? Why would it be this acidic?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I put in some vinegar to give it a special kick.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Excuse moi?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Okay, hear me out. So our customers come to drink, right? It's obviously bad for their liver, but I heard that vinegar is really good for that, so I thought we could...

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I don't want to hear you spilling the beans on vinegar!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: How rude, vinegar isn't even made out of beans.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Oh, shut up. Don't even dare.
Olivia frowns and rubs at the spot between her eyebrows in clear displeasure.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: This is the literal opposite of a secret ingredient. You completely eliminated the taste of the potatoes with it.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: It just tastes like taking a swig of the vinegar bottle.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Oh, good!

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Excuse moi?!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I hear that people in the Orient drink vinegar to stay healthy.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: So what?!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: You look a little healthier already.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: We're talking about a new menu item, right?! Where's all this vinegar bollocks coming from?! You're just full of beans!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: What's with you and beans today? Anyway, it's not bollocks, vinegar is—

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Silence! We didn't even have vinegar in stock! Where did you get it?!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I bought some, see?
I pull an unopened bottle of vinegar from under the counter and place it in front of her.
I was told that it's vinegar made from the same ingredients as wine.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Wine vinegar, okay. It is true that it's good for the body, and it could enhance the flavor of a pottage.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: But don't tell me you put two or three spoonfuls of this in the pot, please. The flavor is too overpowering to add more than a few drops.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I put in the whole thing to see what happened.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: What?! The whole bottle?!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Mhm.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: That's not a secret ingredient! You pickled those poor potatoes! Where did you learn to cook?!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: You know I'm self-taught. No one taught me how to write or how to cook.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Since I'm kind of making the theater thing work out, I imagined I could do the same with cooking.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Well, that's a bloody shame. I see that your talent doesn't go beyond the theather's walls.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: But I—

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: No buts! Anyone with even one lick of cooking aptitude wouldn't spill a whole bottle of vinegar in a bloody soup! This is basic common sense!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Are you sure simply deviating from the norm is such a bad thing?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Do you need to ask?! You used a whole bottle of vinegar!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: But...

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: No bloody buts!
Olivia blows out a sigh of exasperation.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Get out of the way. If you want a new dish that badly, I'll make it. You just go back to the desk and keep writing. I hereby banish you from the kitchen.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: O-Okay...

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Why did you even choose vinegar? Of all the things to get, I swear on the Lord's bones...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I heard the other pubs are selling pickled beans, and they're pretty popular, so I thought it'd be a hit with our patrons.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Apparently they improve the metabolism and cure constipation.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: ...So this really was about beans all along, huh?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Hahah! Now that you mention it, yeah!

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Enough laughter! You really tick me off!
